Class MapGenFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiggerbiggo.prima.processing.fragment.generate.MapGenFragment

extends java.lang.Object
implements Fragment<Vector2>, java.io.Serializable, Controllable
    Generates coordinate maps.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Vector2 get(int x,
                   int y,
                   int w,
                   int h,
                   int num)
        The main calculation method. All processing for a given pixel should be done in this method.

        When generating a map, the returned vector is determined by taking the image size and pixel position and calculating the percentage distance the pixel being rendered lies across the image. For example:

        Consider an image with width 100, height 100:

        • Point (0,0) would be at 0% width 0% height
        • Point (50,50) would be at 50% width, 50% height
        • Point (100,100) would be at 100% width, 100% height
        Next, the point the given pixel would lie is calculated by multiplying the difference in the X and Y coordinates of the bottom left and top right points by the above percentages and adding it to the bottom left coordinate. This results in each rendered pixel being mapped to a coordinate on the number plane. This can then be used by other fragments to generate transformed maps, or to map to coordinates on an image using ImageConvertFragment.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Fragment<Vector2>
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the pixel being rendered
        y - The Y position of the pixel being rendered
        w - The width of the image
        h - The height of the image
        num - The number of frames in the animation
        Returns:
        The output of the fragment

        public ControlPane getControls(ControlPane p)
